website_summaries.verdict: Handy 2-in-1 Chromebook that works as a touchscreen tablet or as a laptop.
pros: The display screen is a little small for a laptop at 10.1 inches, but it's a good size versus tablets
Touchscreen and 2-in-1 capability is nice to find in this price point
Offers up to 9 hours of battery life
Extremely small and lightweight at just 2 pounds, which makes it very portable
cons: Cost is a little high for a Chromebook, but it does have 4 GB of RAM

website_summaries.verdict: The Asus Chromebook Flip C101PA is a capable and likable convertible, but you'll find yourself squinting and zooming to read its 10.1-inch screen and typing gingerly on its downsized keyboard.
cons: Awfully small for adult hands and eyes

customer_reviews.title: Tough Touchscreen Workhorse in Middle School Setting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little machine a year ago and put a $20 shell on it. I use it as a teacher principally for taking roll, issuing token economy points (both via touch screen), and entering grades. I lend it to trusted students to perform some of these tasks. It's been dropped a half dozen times, has a slight bend on one of the corners, and continues to function like a champ. I can drop this little computer in my bag and have to double-check that it's there, it's so small. With offline sync, I can work on my Google docs on the train as I go in and out of wifi service. The battery lasts more than all day.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lee

customer_reviews.title: A great buy if you need something portable and fast!
customer_reviews.text: I have virtually no complaints with this chromebook. It can be folded into different positions for use. It is touchscreen and has a 10 hour battery life. It has been great for doing coursework on the Microsoft office suite of apps. My only downside is the consistency of the touchscrren at times. I have tried to use it for writing notes and I often get breaks in my lines or pauses. This may be due to my stylus rather than the screen but either way, that's my one issue. A great buy overall totally worth the money! I love Asus products.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Ward

customer_reviews.title: Stay away!
customer_reviews.text: This chromebook started having keyboard issues within 6 months of purchase. Like, press the letter Q and it types the letter A etc. Tried to reach out ASUS service center and told us to do a "power wash" or hard factory reset but couldn't guarantee the problem wouldn't come back. They offer zero warranty - Amazon was no help - so don't think you can return past the 30 days and get your money back. All they offered was for us to send it in for repair. Will never purchase from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: Touchscreen is a joke. I've had to use it as a laptop 90% of the time I've had it. I own a MacBook Pro. I don't need another laptop. The wifi is another joke. Barely connects and the few times it does, it basically just buffers until I get frustrated and give up. This is incredibly disappointing. It looks good. But they sacrificed aesthetics for practicability. This was an absolute waste of money, time and energy. Won't be buying any more ASUS products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Cy

customer_reviews.title: cheap chromebook
customer_reviews.text: I was satisfied with this chromebook at first but it developed several problems that ASUS didn't correct. Screen rotation stopped working after an android upgrade. Returned to ASUS for repair but they claimed they could not reproduce the problem and did nothing. They obviously didn't even look at it. The accelerometer was probably not working. I also had had difficulty accessing my wifi gateway although could access other gateways and hotspots well. After receiving my untouched chromebook from ASUS, I asked for a replacement device but they don't replace them, only fix them.
customer_reviews.author: Rich M

customer_reviews.title: Does not last..non functioning within 3 month! Going with another brand.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I thought this would be a god chrome book for my daughter... but the darn thing pooped out within 3 months of purchase. We purchased this on 7-17-18, and a key piped off, and the q, a, and 1 keys do not work. Cannot use. Sorry asus. Buying another brand. Oh, we also place this chrome book carefully after each use in a jell-cushioned carrying sleeve. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable.
customer_reviews.text: Screen cracked after two months of use. Normal use no drops or bangs. Turned on and noticed screen cracked from bottom right to top center. Touch screen no longer works. Expected a lot more for the price.
customer_reviews.author: yooperjj

customer_reviews.title: I loved it so much I bought another one for my wife
customer_reviews.text: Surpassed expectations! Super long battery life, I bought this to not have to go to my desktop and it has done just that. It had resolved my desktop, my tablet, and my laptop. It is the best laptop, tablet that I have ever had, the flip screen allow you to use it in so many different ways making so comfortable to use. Key board is great and easy to use even with my fat fingers. I loved it so much I bought another one for my wife and she loves it too...
customer_reviews.author: Gregory J Tucknies

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I mostly use this for watching netflix, or folded up like a tablet for reading ebooks. But I am prone to violent spats of philosophical research as well as the dedicated pursuit of other esoteric knowledge, and this little guy has kept pace pretty well. Instant on, insane battery life, and the beautiful form factor sold me. The addition of android apps makes this a totally viable platform for all sorts, so if this sounds like a device you would be interested in but you're on the fence don't be afraid to take the plunge.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS LITTLE GUY
customer_reviews.text: I love this computer so far!! I have had a learning curve, luckily I have always been a android user so the hurtle wasn't to big. I work, go to school and have been looking for work so the extent that I have had to use this little guy has been enormous over the last month! Will stay a fan of this chrome notebook and will probably buy another one when this guy poops out on me (hopefully long long time for that!) I was originally a Dell user all the time but this computer is faster and easily converts documents to a format that is compatible with this chrome book, sooooo worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little chrome book
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the Asus Chromebook. I bought the 10" and luv it. It is perfect for traveling. This is my first chromebook, now I've moved my entire life to google and so pleased with the result. Performance is good, nice metal cover, very quick response time. It is so nice to have access to all of the android apps as well. I use skype, whatsapp, and google voice, so in contact with everyone from my computer. Looking forward to trying out the bonus Linux (beta) feature.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little machine
customer_reviews.text: I adore the size of this. Its fast and I can do just about anything on it. The keyboard is nicely done and just the right size. Im very happy with this. Im self employed and this really suits my needs. I love that i can flip it to tablet mode too. Not much internal space but using the chrome cloud you dont need it plus you can use a flash drive or sd card. Great price for all you get out of this. My only wish for this is that the keyboard was back lit. Other then that Im super happy!!
customer_reviews.author: BigJ&K

customer_reviews.title: I love it. Great looking
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter for Christmas. She loves it. I love it. Great looking, really nice feel, well constructed. Great features. But I'm having an issue. My daughter alerted me to this. Sometimes when she's in chrome and scrolls to the top of the page the screen will glitch out. It goes mostly black and the image flickers wildly. Obviously something is wrong. I'm hoping I can exchange it, but I'm not sure if it's been too long. A fix would be ideal if there is one. Can't find anything on Google. I hope we can fix it because other than it's been a really big hit.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Chromebook and I'm really impressed. For what I do, which involves a lot of writing and collaboration with colleagues in Google apps, it works brilliantly. It looks very nice too. Switching between work and personal accounts is a breeze, battery life is very good, and the form factor (even the small keyboard) are to my liking. My only tiny complaints are that the trackpad seems to click on things involuntarily from time to time and that the screen is a fingerprint magnet.
customer_reviews.author: Senkihazireader

customer_reviews.title: Unexpectedly shuts down
customer_reviews.text: When this is working, it's great. I use it daily for work and can say nothing negative about it, EXCEPT is unexpectedly restarts itself self times a day. It gets extremely annoying! I've reinstalled Chrome OS twice and have gone through every applicable fix I have found, but it still has the same problem. I've contacted Asus about it and they've suggested sending it away for diagnostic repair. That may be the trick, but without knowing how long that will take (or what the cost would be since I've had it close to a year), I'm not sure practical it'd be.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Poage

customer_reviews.title: the charger doesn't fit all the way in same as all chromebooks is highly annoying
customer_reviews.text: I am sick of buying these chromebooks...last about a year before you can't charge the stupid things. Even the charger it comes with. I go through 3 chargers and then realize it is not the charger but it is designed terriblyand the charger has a bout a quarter inch that does not fit in :( again I have to buy a new one but trying Acer this time.
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: It has potential for a whole lot more, but well made at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: This one is a little different then the first one (C100PA) but it is very well made. It's aluminum body and frame make it very durable. It has a USB type-c Port which is pretty good and the reason I bought it. The keyboard is small but still not to hard to work with. The mouse pad is sensitive to the touch. All in all I would say, as if right now I can recommend this Chromebook and if it holds up like the first one is a great deal. Very portable, lightweight, sleek design and sturdy. If anything changes as I use it more, I will come back and update the review.
customer_reviews.author: Tino Fuentes

customer_reviews.title: Fragile as an egg shell
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to my wife, as she needed a light an small laptop. The first let down (not ASUS's fault) is that due to a misleading propaganda from Microsoft, althought is has a 10.1" screen, Microsoft Office IS NOT FREE to this device). The other one is that when it fell off my bed (2 ft height) it broke its screen and now it is a $320 PAPER WEIGHT
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo K Lima

customer_reviews.title: Device arrives defective
customer_reviews.text: Chromebook arrived but will not boot with error 'chrome os is damaged or missing'. I followed the recovery process to create a recovery USB stick and start recovery. Recovery will not start with error 'security module is missing'. Call Asus, they said to return the device, it is defective. Called Amazon, they send me to talk to Asus again. Asus said I need to talk to Amazon again. I am a ping pong ball. Make long story short, Amazon finally agreed to take back the device. That was a painful experience.
customer_reviews.author: Roland Y.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, for as long as it works.
customer_reviews.text: This slim, lightweight machine has a premium look and feel with its aluminum case and "island" keyboard (although the keyboard is slightly smaller than standard). The ability to bend it into a tent position makes it great for demonstrations or home video viewing. Chrome OS and Google Docs and Sheets are great, I'll never go back to Windows and Office. Sadly, I've bought two Asus Flips and each has malfuntioned, the second less than a year before failure. The first simply would not turn on anymore. My second has a keyboard with dead keys. I now need to purchase my third Chromebook in five years. I think I'll try another brand and hope for the best.
customer_reviews.author: TGW

customer_reviews.title: 5* I even bought my mom one!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love mine! The only thing I wish it had similar to tablets because of the limited storage would be a micro SD slot. One thing I have to give credit to is that it was left outside and get automatic sprinklers watered it for 30 minutes, I took it inside and turned it off (Yes it was still on and running) dried it with a towel removed the back panel Stir It Up in front of a fan for 4 days and by some miracle it's still works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: AisForRebel

customer_reviews.title: Loved mine so bought another for a gift
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the previous model in 2016 to use when my larger laptop wasn't available or wasn't convenient. I've been using it for emails, research, etc. I find this Asus perfect for my usage and really like the dual capabilities of touch screen and a keyboard. The flip is also a great option. My grandson used my Asus when he visited so I recently bought him this current 2018 model. He uses it daily for homework, emails, research, games and is thrilled with it. It's lightweight, the battery lasts as advertised and recharges quickly. For the price, it is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: GenerousGrandma

customer_reviews.title: would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I rarely review, but this thing is an absolute pleasure to use. It does not feel cheap, even for the price; the keyboard is pleasant to type on, screen is clear enough, plenty of processing power for browsing. This machine is my go to couch laptop, and has replaced my dell xps 13 for everything except for when I need a machine for serious programming. I did not experience any of the manufacturing defects that others have mentioned (even though I bought it used from amazon). 10/10, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Steven M.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Writing this on September 10th 2018 - It still wont run Minecraft from the Play Store but that is ok because that is not why I bought it. Its works great on the web and it does everything well and didn't break the bank. Kids use them for school and some games The kids love them and 1st one (1 model lower) is now 3 years old and I am still told "Thanks, I love my chromebook" every few months. The 3 years of thanks from a teenage daughter for 1 Christmas present is a damn good deal and
customer_reviews.author: NO Way

customer_reviews.title: Great for schoolwork
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use on campus at my college, and it works well for that purpose. It is small and has a long battery life; I can have music on in the background, articles, and a word document up at the same time and still have low battery drainage. I've had it for almost a year now, and the only issue is the monitor occasionally turns itself off when I attempt to plug in the power cord or the headphone jack. Not too bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Karmen Freeman

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: This was delivered a little later than expected. I had to follow up several times as the delivery window kept growing. In terms of chromebook, smaller than I expected, the operating system felt too constricting due to simplicity, the keyboard is too different than our work laptop so remoting in to work wouldn't work unfortunately, but it's a good solid web browser
customer_reviews.author: MUKI LOK UNG

customer_reviews.title: weak wifi card
customer_reviews.text: I don't know whether something is wrong with the new unit I bought this month. But the wifi card doesn't pick up, or maintain, the wifi signals easily picked up by my 3 year old low-priced Chromebook. I really like other things about it, but if all units of this model have weak wifi, I will have to just return it instead of exchanging it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Tierney

customer_reviews.title: Honest review
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I needed this computer for very minimal needs so it serves its purpose and everything seems to be great with it so far. I will update if anything goes wrong in future with it.
customer_reviews.author: Delaney

customer_reviews.title: Great port selection! Super versatile!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little Chromebook! i wanted to get the bigger 12in with the m5 chip but it lacked a usb A port for backwards compatibility! this is small, portable and has an excellent battery life! the 2 type c ports and the A port make this thing super versatile! wish the 12in had the same connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: boycrazyboy

customer_reviews.title: So easy to transport!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a small Chromebook to carry around, this is about as good as it gets. The keyboard is smallish but easy to type on. The screen has way more black borders than it needs to have for a notebook, however when using it as a tablet you'll realize that those borders are a good thing. I was initially worried about the low resolution of the screen (1280x800), but it turned out to be no problem since the screen is small. 1920x1200 would be stellar to have though. This Chromebook runs Crostini (Linux) and Android apps too to top it off. All in all still the most transportable Chromebook available with a lot of features.
customer_reviews.author: Harald Kubota

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I absolutely loved this Chromebook. It is fast and worked great. That is up until I had it for 3 months. Out of nowhere I plugged it in and there is a loud "whirring" noise coming from just to the left of the charging port. The laptop says it is charging but the battery percentage does not go up. I am sending it in for warranty work, but if this is the quality of ASUS items I will not be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard will not work
customer_reviews.text: YouTube videos say the cable is not connected and to remove all the screws from the back and reconnect the cable. This is a BRAND NEW machine, and I have ablsolutely NO idea what I am doing. I will not open the back and try to fix this. I need a replacement. I really like the tablet but it won't work!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customerhhvvbnhj

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This size tablet was just what I needed. The huge problem is You Tube videos began to buffer after a few minutes. I've tried everything to get it to work. I've checked all blog fix it post. Nothing has worked. Would send it back, but way past return deadline. Better luck to you if you should decide to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Tex

customer_reviews.title: It's what you expected and its gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Looking for cheap option to get work done. This will get it done. Another the specs are a little on the light side, I thought it would be a little more snappy because it as close to a blank slate as possible. But it works for sending emails and typing docs. Plays YouTube just fine. Light weight and small and is jus all around ok. You see it for good price you wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: David Jean-Baptiste

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 months :(
customer_reviews.text: I had my last chrome book for many years and loved it. This one I have had for six months, and it is already unusable. I enjoyed using it while it was working, but last month the charger stopped charging. I Purchased a replacement and now although it says it is charging, the Chromebook will not turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why this Chromebook was highly rated
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed in the Asus Chromebook flip that I recently purchased. It was rated in a top five review of Chromebooks that I saw for its price point but it runs extremely slow in some apps. I've tried all of the online tips to no avail. When I flip it to tablet mode, certain apps stop working and/or won't launch. Very disappointed as I was looking for something to replace my Samsung Tab A (which worked flawlessly) that acted more like a laptop. I'm going to keep looking for fixes but buyer beware of this Chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: Worked well but nothing special for long term.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a while back and for about a year it worked. Then the laptop overheated and the internal CPU fried up last week. Was nice while it lasted, but it seems warranty might be good just in case for this product. Maybe I got a dud, but it was a nice item while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Platypus

customer_reviews.title: 1 year in use
customer_reviews.text: This laptop was great when I first got it, but now a year later it does not work as it used to. It glitched and went off once and when I press the back arrow, it does not work sometimes in certain places. I am currently typing my review on it. It's very light and tiny and that is the plus side of why I got this laptop. It's sad that it does not work as well as it used to, because I use this laptop everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Cool on the outside, poopy on the inside.
customer_reviews.text: There's a lot to love about this laptop. It's tiny and portable, the touchscreen is awesome, the refresh button on the keyboard is genius, great OS, and having a laptop and tablet in the same machine is totally rockin. Unfortunately, the guts need some work. The trackpad is really sticky. The speaker is very tinny and doesn't get very loud. The laptop gets really warm almost immediately. Apps I downloaded wouldn't work (Netflix, Google Play Music). The straw that broke the camel's back was when I opened Chrome and it couldn't load my own website, even though it was the only tab open. Also, who is using USB 2.0 these days? That port should be a USB 3.0. DUH.
customer_reviews.author: Jacki Moo

customer_reviews.title: Battery and tech support are terrible
customer_reviews.text: Battery lasted just past the year warranty. Now I have a paperweight that Asus wont do anything about.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Love this Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Suites my needs perfectly. Only issue I've found is the screen will not rotate when a wireless USB mouse is used. This seems to be a common issue. That said, I love this product. Would I buy it again? Absolutely.
customer_reviews.author: dkh1020

customer_reviews.title: My go to computer.
customer_reviews.text: Most people who want to browse the web and use their favorite apps can't go wrong with this Chromebook. Gets regular updates. Runs Android apps very well. The only real downside to this computer is the number of nice Chromebooks that are being released that could be a better alternative (HP x2, I've got my eye on you) to this two-in-one.
customer_reviews.author: E. Pasco

customer_reviews.title: Defective issues with connectors.
customer_reviews.text: I really wish Asus would correct their faulty keyboard ribbon cable connector problem my second Asus that failed within a Year's use. Sharp looking product liked it accept for the ribbon cable connector issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Money saver while fitting the bill!
customer_reviews.text: I needed something portable to take around for multiple things. It is quick, lightweight and navigates the internet quickly. I keep a one drive storage so I can access all documents and save on this computer also.
customer_reviews.author: Bayou belle

customer_reviews.title: Fragile screen
customer_reviews.text: Screen is more fragile than other tablets. I will not be purchasing this brand again. Customer service was headache to deal with for repair. Read warranty very well before buying.
customer_reviews.author: TroyB42

customer_reviews.title: A great fast excellent Chromebook Tablet
customer_reviews.text: This Chromebook is fantastic ... I have it now for three months and works fast and is excellent in all aspect ... very good picture... good fo movies and everything I have to work with as Google Docs is offering all that one could miss with Microsoft word ...
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: Can't be more happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Best laptop I have, used to have a MacBook Pro 2010 and can't be more happy, great battery, touch screen, supper fast , I can't have all my Excel documents but I have all I need with free Office for Word, Excel, etc. Get an external micro SD since you will need it.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Barrera

customer_reviews.title: Chromebook doesn’t work with some printers.
customer_reviews.text: Depending on your situation just know that chromebooks will not work with all printers as I found out, your printer has to be cloud ready ? which I discovered after purchasing my chromebook, if you don’t want to buy a new printer as well with a chromebook do some research it never dawned on me that my printer wouldn’t work with it, buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Very nice computer but small
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife. It operates and looks great. My wife loves it. However, for me, it is too small and would not be useful in my profession. The keyboard is small and the screen is small. But for emails and surfing the internet it is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Very Short Life!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 in November 2018. both no longer work. They will not start up. Tried all options but no success. Will not buy again. If you do get warranty extension.
customer_reviews.author: cujobaby

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine till the screen cracked.
customer_reviews.text: It worked better than I thought it would for the price, and I was quite pleased with it. However, after taking it out of my backpack I found a small hairline crack on the screen, barely noticeable. Had there not been a way to disable the touchscreen the chromebook would have been useless due to the touchscreen now giving random imputs everywhere. I am quite surprised the screen cracked so easily, and even more surprised that this would cause the touchscreen to nearly brick the computer. Non tech savy people would most likely just throw it out. I expected more from ASUS...
customer_reviews.author: Karen Rogers

customer_reviews.title: I bought it as a laptop for kids, connected ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a laptop for kids, connected it to a monitor with USB-C - HDMI connector, and this set up works!! It also has a SD-card slot. I use it for 200GB SD card for cartoons and movies storage.
customer_reviews.author: Kira Vardin

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: My chromebook only lasted one year. It blacked out and I tried all the suggested fixes. Nothing worked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hardware Issues - Became Disposable
customer_reviews.text: Became disposable after a line of keys stopped working. One of the keys popped off as well. $$$ to send it in and no option to purchase new keys. Customer servit, unfortunately, was there to read scripts of costs. It performed very well before this issue. We got 9 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good quality, runs not too bad
customer_reviews.text: ok product, good quality, runs not too bad, slightly warm on the bottom by comparing my other Chromebook C-213s, but i like the facts that it is 10 inches size and decent performance and quality. if you don't mind 11 inches size, i would recommend you buy C-213S with 32GB memory.
customer_reviews.author: Alisa Deng

customer_reviews.title: Size-performance combinaion
customer_reviews.text: I like its size and performance as a complement to my smartphone and substitute a tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Jose F

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine, but...
customer_reviews.text: It seems like a great portable computer, but it lacks in processing power. If it had the same processing power as it's 12.5 inch version, it would have been perfect. I would even pay more money for it. Unfortunately, it lags when streaming videos and screen resolution could be much improved.
customer_reviews.author: Odessit

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Rockchip processor provides more than adequate performance. Screen brightness decent. Google Play shipped as Beta but seems to work well. I have loaded the MS mobile apps and they work well. Keyboard has a nice touch / travel. Trackpad just OK, but I haven't tried any sensitivity adjustments. Very pleased with my purchase. And if anyone was wondering...when you insert a microSD card, it does sit flush with the side of the chassis, although there is no "door." It is "spring-loaded" so push in/click to insert, push in/ click to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Dorf

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Asus chromebook that has bricked out on me, this time after only 2 months! Absolutely will never buy another again
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck laptop you can buy.
customer_reviews.text: Great product! No lag. Incredible battery life. Bought this instead of a MacBook air and I have no regrets. I regularly use it as a tablet on long flights and as a PC for work.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Good for kids
customer_reviews.text: Small, good quality. Touch pad requires a harder touch that I would like. Perfect for kids and their school work.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing laptop
customer_reviews.text: As an online student with a newborn I needed a laptop that was easy to tote around and use without having to charge it all the time. This Chromebook fits my every need perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product specifically for my daughter for her online school but we tried using online Microsoft teams and the computer just glitches and doesn't work. We bought this laptop and it cant even work for the reason we bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Nicey Hilton

customer_reviews.title: better speaker. I still hate the search button
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than my last Chromebook, better speaker. I still hate the search button, would prefer having a caps lock button then another redundant search method on it.
customer_reviews.author: Retromama

customer_reviews.title: No audio recording software available!
customer_reviews.text: This chromebook is fast and efficient, excellent for internet browsing and watching movies, but if you're a musician and you like to record audio on the go, it's worthless. Great for everyday use like work or college, but nothing else. There's no app to use in the Play Store, free or paid, for audio. Best for this purpose is an iPad to use Garageband. That's the only reason I gave it 4/5, otherwise would be a 5/5!
